00020 
00021 #include "MMDATFileWriter.h"
00022 #include "DATData.h"
00023 
00024 
00025 /* General Description of the file writing process
00026  * The MMDATFileWriter extends the DATFileWriter by adding memory-mapped view
00027  * to the pixel DataSet data.
00028  * The DATFileWriter constructor writes the FileHeader, GenericDataHeader, DataGroupHeader
00029  * and DataSetHeader using fstream.  The header positions are computed and written in the proper
00030  * place at construction.
00031  * The Open method opens a memory mapped view on the pixel DataSet data section.  Data can be
00032  * written to the file by changing the data in the memory mapped view.  The view can also 
00033  * be moved over the pixel data to access all the data.  The view size is restricted to 
00034  * 200 MB at a time.
00035  * Closing the file will also cause the pixel data to be written to the file in network byte-order.
00036  * Warning: Using the same DATData object to re-open the file with the MMDATFileWriter would make it
00037  * possible to access the pixel data that is not in host byte-order.  You do not want to do this.
00038  * Once the MMDATFileWriter is closed, the file should be opened with the DATFileReader to access
00039  * the data.  Re-opening a file with the MMDATFileWriter to overwrite an existing file is OK.
00040  */
00041 
00042 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_io;
00043 
00044 /*
00045  * Constructor
00046  */
00047 MMDATFileWriter::MMDATFileWriter(DATData &p) : DATFileWriter(p)
00048 {
00049         pixelWriter = 0;
00050         filename = p.GetFilename();
00051         dataSetHdr = p.GetFileHeader()->GetDataGroup(0).FindDataSetHeader(DAT_PIXEL);
00052         rows = p.GetRows();
00053         cols = p.GetCols();
00054 }
00055 
00056 /*
00057  * Destructor
00058  */
00059 MMDATFileWriter::~MMDATFileWriter() 
00060 {
00061         Close();
00062 }
00063 
00064 /*
00065  * Opens the writer.
00066  */
00067 bool MMDATFileWriter::Open()
00068 {
00069         if (pixelWriter == 0)
00070         {
00071                 if (dataSetHdr != 0)
00072                 {
00073                         pixelWriter = new MMDataSetDataWriter(*dataSetHdr, filename);
00074                 }
00075                 else
00076                         return false;
00077         }
00078 
00079         if (pixelWriter)
00080                 return pixelWriter->Open();
00081         else
00082                 return false;
00083 }
00084 
00085 /*
00086  * Closes the writer.
00087  */
00088 bool MMDATFileWriter::Close()
00089 {
00090         if (pixelWriter)
00091         {
00092                 HTONPixelDataSet();
00093                 bool ret = pixelWriter->Close();
00094                 delete pixelWriter;
00095                 pixelWriter = 0;
00096                 return ret;
00097         }
00098         else
00099                 return true;
00100 }
00101 
00102 /*
00103  * Maps the pixel data for access starting at firstRow and continuing for rowsToMap.
00104  */
00105 void MMDATFileWriter::MapPixelData(int32_t firstRow, int32_t rowsToMap)
00106 {
00107         if (pixelWriter)
00108         {
00109                 pixelWriter->MapData(firstRow*cols, rowsToMap*cols);
00110         }
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*
00114  * Get a pointer to the pixel data that has been mapped for access.
00115  */
00116 u_int16_t* MMDATFileWriter::GetMappedPixelDataPtr()
00117 {
00118         if (pixelWriter)
00119         {
00120                 return (u_int16_t*)pixelWriter->GetMappedDataPtr();
00121         }
00122         return 0;
00123 }
00124 
00125 /*
00126  * Get the first DAT image row that has been mapped.
00127  */
00128 int32_t MMDATFileWriter::GetFirstPixelRowMapped()
00129 {
00130         if (pixelWriter)
00131         {
00132                 return pixelWriter->GetFirstRowMapped()/cols;
00133         }
00134         return 0;
00135 }
00136 
00137 /*
00138  * Get the number of DAT image rows that have been mapped.
00139  */
00140 int32_t MMDATFileWriter::GetPixelRowsMapped()
00141 {
00142         if (pixelWriter)
00143         {
00144                 return pixelWriter->GetRowsMapped()/cols;
00145         }
00146         return 0;
00147 }
00148 
00149 /*
00150  * Get the suggested maximum number of DAT image rows to map.
00151  */
00152 int32_t MMDATFileWriter::GetMaxPixelRowsToMap()
00153 {
00154         if (pixelWriter)
00155         {
00156                 return pixelWriter->GetMaxRowsToMap()/cols;
00157         }
00158         return 0;
00159 }
00160 
00161 /*
00162  * Writes the pixel DataSet data in network byte order.
00163  */
00164 void MMDATFileWriter::HTONPixelDataSet()
00165 {
00166         if (pixelWriter)
00167         {
00168                 pixelWriter->Close();
00169                 if (pixelWriter->Open())
00170                 {
00171                         bool stop = false;
00172                         do
00173                         {
00174                                 int32_t firstPixel = pixelWriter->GetFirstRowMapped();
00175                                 int32_t numPixelsMapped = pixelWriter->GetRowsMapped();
00176                                 u_int16_t* pixel = (u_int16_t*)pixelWriter->GetMappedDataPtr();
00177                                 for (int32_t i = 0; i < numPixelsMapped; ++i, ++pixel)
00178                                 {
00179                                         *pixel = htons(*pixel);
00180                                 }
00181 
00182                                 if (firstPixel+numPixelsMapped >= rows*cols)
00183                                         stop = true;
00184                                 else
00185                                         pixelWriter->MapData(firstPixel+numPixelsMapped, pixelWriter->GetMaxRowsToMap());
00186                         } while (stop == false);
00187                 }
00188         }
00189 }
